definition: to estimate/to reckon/CL:個|个[ge4]/(coll.) to suppose
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge

pinyin: zui4 da4 si4 ran2 gu1 ji4

sentences.english: China's fertility rate may be much lower than official estimates.
sentences.chinese: 中國人口高增長率可能會比政府估計的要低很多。

sentences.english: How should we evaluate China's educational work in the first 17 years?
sentences.chinese: 對全國教育戰線十七年的工作怎樣估計？

sentences.english: An estimated four thousand types of forams live in the world’s oceans.
sentences.chinese: 據估計，在海洋中生活着4000種有孔蟲。

sentences.english: An estimated fifth of them are in the country illegally.
sentences.chinese: 據估計，這些拉美裔人口中約五分之一都是非法移民。

sentences.english: Diatoms are also quite numerous, with the estimated number of species exceeding one million.
sentences.chinese: 硅藻種類也相當多，估計超過1百萬種。

sentences.english: Each year, an estimated 500 billion to 1 trillion plastic bags are consumed worldwide.
sentences.chinese: 每年全球的膠袋使用量估計有5千億到1萬億個。
他估計這枚戒指值80美元。

sentences.english: Next step, figure out how to capture and communicate those changes.
sentences.chinese: 下一步，估計如何捕捉和溝通這些變化。

sentences.english: Berlin estimates it lost a record five million euros last year to fare dodgers.
sentences.chinese: 柏林估計它去年由於逃票人造成了五百萬英鎊的損失。

sentences.english: The results also show that significant performances the estimator in extreme low signal-to-noise ratio can be obtained.
sentences.chinese: 同時該結果也顯示在低信噪比下的估計器的卓越性能。

sentences.english: The estimated time of burial was placed in the early Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 埋藏的時間估計在唐朝早期。

sentences.english: An initial police estimate put the number of participants at 8,000.
sentences.chinese: 警方初步估計參與遊行的人數達到了8000。

sentences.english: We obtain an upper bounded estimate for the convergence rate of the piecewise linear interpolation.
sentences.chinese: 給出了分段線性插值收斂速度的一種估計。

sentences.english: The police said he self-painted it before he committed suicide.
sentences.chinese: 警方估計是他自殺前自己塗上的。

sentences.english: It would appear to be at least an order of magnitude greater than that.
sentences.chinese: 可能至少要比估計的大一個量級。

sentences.english: Really there is economic brains, yet estimate also together here be one performing in collusion because malign purpose of commander.
sentences.chinese: 的確有經濟頭腦，但估計也同這裏當官的狼狽爲奸。

definition: only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge
after all/all in all/when all is said and done/in the final analysis
improbable/unlikely/will not (act, happen etc)/not able/not having learned to do sth/(coll.) (Tw) don't mention it/not at all
at the minimum/at the very least
should/ought to/probably/must be/to deserve/to owe/to be sb's turn to do sth/that/the above-mentioned
only natural/as it should be/certainly/of course/without doubt
outcome/result/conclusion/in the end/as a result/to kill/to dispatch
